description: Alteration of mic, clipping of microphone. Attested since 1927.

examples: "Then I say to the recording, for the record," I barked, right into the mike,  […]

verbs.description: mike (third-person singular simple present mikes, present participle miking, simple past and past participle miked)

entries.meaning: To microphone; to place one or more microphones (mikes) on.
examples: “And sometimes I’d just have to mike the room. You could run into some weird phasing problems with the individual mics  because the speakers were all reacting differently.”
Measure  Valve-Stem Diameter—To be positive about it you’ll have to mike the valve stem with a 1-in. micrometer as explained on pages 100 and 101.

description: From translingual Mike, representing the letter m, from English Mike.

entries.meaning: (international standards) Alternative letter-case form of Mike from the NATO/ICAO Phonetic Alphabet.

examples: We'll be there in one zero mikes [i.e. ten minutes].

The beginner's dose may be anywhere from 100 to 250 mikes — micrograms, or millionths of a gram. Most hardened heads need 600 to 800 mikes, and some as many as 1,400 mikes, before they experience any sensation of getting off.
